name: Adobo
description: In the Philippines, adobo is a popular comfort food where ingredients are simmered in a mixture of vinegar, soy sauce, crushed garlic, bay leaves, and black peppercorns. The key characteristic is the use of vinegar for preservation and flavor, a practice that predates Spanish colonization, with the Spanish applying the name "adobo" (meaning "marinade" in Spanish) to the indigenous method they observed.
